definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: During the first half of life, people look ahead to the second half.
sentences.chinese: 在前半生里，人们向前看后半生。

sentences.english: What could I do with the second half of my life to make it more meaningful than the first?
sentences.chinese: 要怎样才能让自己的后半生比之前更有意义？

sentences.english: His sad voice to a vine life after made at a loss.
sentences.chinese: 那伤感的声音把一棵藤的后半生弄得不知所措。

sentences.english: He spent the latter half of his life in Oxford.
sentences.chinese: 他的后半生是在牛津度过的。

sentences.english: But during the second half of life, people look back the first half.
sentences.chinese: 而在后半生里，人们回头看前半生。

sentences.english: Or to live the rest of your life on a farm in Kansas?
sentences.chinese: 抑或，后半生居住在堪萨斯农场？

sentences.english: Look, you already have more than enough money to see you through the rest of your life.
sentences.chinese: 看，你已经有了足够的钱，后半生可以生活无忧了。

sentences.english: Wells said she had planned to live the rest of her life with Elson.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔斯说，她本打算后半生同埃尔森一起生活。

sentences.english: I had this image of his just being this mess later in his life.
sentences.chinese: 之所以这么说，是因为我觉得他的后半生过得很糟糕。

sentences.english: I am looking for a kind hearted, well-educated woman to spend the rest of my life with.
sentences.chinese: 我想找个心肠好，有文化的女人来和我度过后半生。
他的后半生一直过着流浪的生活。

definition: glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
